properties.SITE_FEATURE_DESCRIPTION:
Prevents future release of contamination (OSWER Directive 9355.7-04 May 25, 1995) through two components of regulation. One component identifies the property as a Superfund Site in the Boulder County Planning Dept. of Records, thus referencing the area as such when development applications are submitted to the County. The second component is a locally enforced development prohibition identified in the Intergovernmental Agreement US 36 Corridor Comprehensive Development Plan. This agreement prohibits municipalities from granting development permits for the area designated as a Rural Preservation Planning Area including the Superfund Site.
